intro: Alectorolophus perinicus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. It is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. Alectorolophus perinicus requires indirect light and well-draining soil to flourish.
